function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Investigating size distribution of airborne SARS-CoV-2 droplets in a specific location during the COVID-19 outbreak.","Impact":"Understanding the potential for airborne transmission of the virus in indoor environments.","Mitigation":"Implementing effective ventilation and air filtration systems to reduce the concentration of airborne viruses.","Technologies":"HEPA filters, UV-C air purifiers, and mechanical ventilation systems.","People":"Patients, medical staff, and individuals in the built environment.","Owner":"Healthcare facility management, building owners, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Resuspension of virus-laden aerosols from the surface of protective apparel worn by medical staff.","Impact":"Increased risk of virus transmission due to the presence of airborne particles in indoor spaces.","Mitigation":"Regular cleaning and disinfection of surfaces, proper training on safe removal of protective equipment, and usage of personal protective equipment (PPE).","Technologies":"Disinfectants, ultraviolet germicidal irradiation (UVGI) systems, and surface cleaning technologies.","People":"Medical staff, patients, and individuals in the built environment.","Owner":"Healthcare facility management, infection control departments, and occupational health and safety personnel."},{"Description":"Resuspension of particle matter from walking events in indoor spaces.","Impact":"Elevated presence of resuspended particles, including potential virus-laden particles, in the indoor environment.","Mitigation":"Use of walk-off mats, regular cleaning of carpets, and implementation of dust control measures.","Technologies":"Walk-off mats, vacuum cleaners with HEPA filters, and air purifiers.","People":"Occupants of indoor spaces, including patients, visitors, and staff.","Owner":"Building management, facility maintenance staff, and environmental health and safety personnel."}]}
